q: Pro Tem Dwaine Caraway gave a "key to the city" to Michael Vick . The action spawned outrage from many North Texans( including NBCDFW Mayor Tom Leppert releasing the following statement on Monday afternoon: The action taken was not sanctioned by my office and was not an official ceremonial honor on behalf of the City of Dallas. Official Keys to the City are presented by the Mayor Tom Leppert , or an elected official designated by the Mayor Tom Leppert , and reserved, on a limited basis, for an elected official of international status. Clearly, this was not the case in this situation and done without my knowledge or approval. Given these circumstances I have requested the City Manager propose guidelines to prevent this situation in the future. Dwaine Caraway also released a statement in conjunction with Mayor Tom Leppert , saying: "

But Donald Rumsfeld insists that if senior military officers had reservations about the size of the invading force, they never informed him, the Post said. Howard Stern calls for Hollywood to boycott Jay Leno ( video) Howard Stern ended his third and final segment on Thursday night's Late Show once again pushing for David Letterman to holler back at him off camera: "Maybe we'll get our relationship on track. I want to say this. I offered my apology and it's sincere. If you trust that I'm somewhat normal now, what we'll do is we'll start by calling each other and then maybe I'll come out to Montana and I'll stare at the wall with you and we'll see what happens." , Peter Rice confirmed there would be four judges on the show, two men and two women, but insisted Simon Cowell would not be making the final decision on who would appear on it. He said: There's great speculation. I think Simon Cowell is still meeting and trying to find the right mixture. It'll be four judges as it is in England- it's two men, two women, one of which will be Simon Cowell .' " Simon Cowell 's going to come to us and he's going to say, "This is who I would like the judges to be,' and we'll have a conversation about it. Peter Rice also claimed the show would be different from` American Idol" because of the involvement of judges with their acts, meaning they could find the next " Stevie Wonder or Michael Jackson ".
